AD_LookingForInstrument.synopsis: The bard is looking for her instrument in the vicinity of her playing spot.

AD_InstrumentStolen.synopsis: The bard is sitting. Snaps at the player.

AD_InstrumentBroken.synopsis: The bars is sitting alone - crying. Player has broken her instrument.

Bard.synopsis:
Alfira is a young bard who was apprenticed to a woman called Lihala. On their journey to the camp, they were attacked by gnolls, and Lihala died horribly.
Alfira is trying to compose a song in honour of the teacher she loved so dearly, but is struggling. The player can help her play, talk ther through the lyrics, steal her instrument, or even convince her to give up music.
This is a very soft and touching moment in the grove. Should Alfira finish her song (with the aid of the player) she will stand up and sing it in a cinematic scene.
Bard.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto 280; 4984. Talk to Alfira

AD_QuitComposing.synopsis: Dejected, the bard wonders what she will do as the player has convinced her to give up music.

AD_Dejected.synopsis: Dejected/crying because her instrument was stolen or smashed by a player.

Animals.synopsis: This occurs as the bard, Alfira is playing her lute. The animals are NOT impressed and making fun of her and the player. They are very dramatic.

AD_ComposingSong.synopsis: The bard is struggling to come up with a song to accompany her lute.

AD_StartingOver.synopsis: AD that plays after the bard has been told to start over. She is holding her lute. Not plucking it occasionally but not really playing.

AD_FullSong.synopsis: The bard is playing on her lute and singing the full song the player helped her compose.

AD_LookingForInstrument_0.speaker: Alfira
AD_LookingForInstrument_0.text: No, no, no. It was right here.
AD_LookingForInstrument_0.context: NodeContext: Frantic and panicked as you search for your instrument.

AD_LookingForInstrument_1.speaker: Alfira
AD_LookingForInstrument_1.context: NodeContext: Frantic and panicked as you search for your instrument.

AD_LookingForInstrument_3.speaker: Alfira
AD_LookingForInstrument_3.text: I can't believe I lost it - I'm so stupid.
AD_LookingForInstrument_3.context: NodeContext: Frantic and panicked as you search for your instrument.

AD_InstrumentStolen_0.speaker: Alfira
AD_InstrumentStolen_0.text: Get away from me. I mean it!
AD_InstrumentStolen_0.context: NodeContext: Player has stolen her dead teacher's instrument. You're upset and yelling at the player.

AD_InstrumentBroken_0.speaker: Alfira
AD_InstrumentBroken_0.context: NodeContext: Player has broken her precious lute. You're upset and yelling at the player.

AD_InstrumentBroken_1.speaker: Alfira
AD_InstrumentBroken_1.context: NodeContext: Bawling your eyes out. Incredibly upset.

Bard_21.speaker: Alfira
Bard_21.text: I'm not cut out to be a bard. Or much else, if I'm honest.
Bard_21.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bard is sitting on the rock. No lute. Arms around herself - devastated. NodeContext: Dejected. Devastated.

Bard_181.speaker: Alfira
Bard_181.text: Guess I'll see what Baldur's Gate brings.
Bard_181.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bard is sitting on the rock. No lute.NodeContext: Dejected. Devastated.

Bard_52.speaker: Alfira
Bard_52.text: Sorry, I need to do this on my own.
Bard_52.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bard is sitting on the rock.NodeContext: Annoyed and frustrated with herself. She wants to finish the song but it isn't going anywhere.

Bard_69.speaker: Alfira
Bard_69.text: Leave me alone. I mean it.
Bard_69.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standing. Holding lute close.NodeContext: Player stole but then returned her instrument. She's a little afraid and just wishes to be left alone.

Bard_73.speaker: Alfira
Bard_73.text: It was right here. Someone must have taken it.
Bard_73.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bard is standing. looking around frantically. Gesturing in a 'wtf' fashion. NodeContext: Her teacher's lute is missing. It means the world to her and she's heartbroken and angry that someone would take it. Also blames herself for not keeping a better eye on it.

Bard_201.speaker: Player
Bard_201.text: You already have an instrument. Why do you need another?

Bard_151.speaker: Alfira
Bard_151.text: It was my teacher's. And it's - it's all I have left.
Bard_151.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bard is still standing next to the rock.NodeContext: Player has asked about the missing lute. She's upset and angry.

Bard_224.speaker: Alfira
Bard_224.text: I'm not going to ask where you got this. Just... thank you. Now, please leave.
Bard_224.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bard is still standing at the end of the node.NodeContext: Suspects the player had something to do with it. Doesn't want to know. Just wants to be left alone with her lute. Doesn't want the trouble.

Bard_143.speaker: Alfira
Bard_143.text: I should never have let it out of my sight. I'm an idiot.
Bard_143.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bard is still standing at the end of the node.NodeContext: Almost on the brink of tears at the thought of the missing lute. Feels stupid. Like it's her fault and she's nothing but useless.

Bard_110.speaker: Player
Bard_110.text: Consider this a lesson - don't be careless.

Bard_260.speaker: Player
Bard_260.text: You really should be more careful.

Bard_88.speaker: Alfira
Bard_88.text: Dance upon the stars tonight. Smile and pain will fade away. Words of mine will change - no. Become - ugh.
Bard_88.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lightly strumming her lute. Not looking at the player. NodeContext: Softly singing. Sadness in every note. There is a small pause between every line as you softly sing.

Bard_122.speaker: Alfira
Bard_122.context: NodeContext: Trying to make 'change' fit. Considering tone. Dammit is a curse as she dramatically yells. Angry at herself.

Bard_25.speaker: Player
Bard_25.text: Tough audience. Those animals weren't shy with their criticisms.

Bard_290.speaker: Alfira
Bard_290.text: I... I thought they were cheering me on.
Bard_290.context: NodeContext: Sounds dejected. Surpised and sad.

Bard_53.speaker: Alfira
Bard_53.text: Urgh. Even animals think I'm terrible. I want to finish this song, but I can't - nothing fits, you know?
Bard_53.context: NodeContext: Frustrated with herself. Doesn't feel good enough.

Bard_249.speaker: Player
Bard_249.text: There's no singing voice that could save those lyrics. You know that, right?

Bard_185.speaker: Alfira
Bard_185.context: NodeContext: No is sad sadly, and then she barks a yes realising she's answered it wrong. Embarassed,

Bard_216.speaker: Alfira
Bard_216.text: I'm trying to finish this bloody song. And it's not... nothing fits, you know?
Bard_216.context: NodeContext: Annoyed and frustrated with herself.

Bard_162.speaker: Alfira
Bard_162.text: More like butchering. Don't know why I bother.
Bard_162.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking at lute - frustratedNodeContext: Speaking of her own music. Embarassed and frustrated with herself. Dejected.

Bard_254.speaker: Player
Bard_254.text: The animals agreed. Why else do you think they left?

Bard_12.speaker: Alfira
Bard_12.text: No. I'm moments away from a grisly death...
Bard_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks at player. NodeContext: Sarcasm mixed with frustation.

Bard_239.speaker: Alfira
Bard_239.text: ...at the hands of this bloody song. I can't... nothing fits, you know?
Bard_239.context: NodeContext: Annoyed and frustrated with herself.

Bard_34.speaker: Player
Bard_34.text: Let me see if I can help.

Bard_161.speaker: Player
Bard_161.text: That's the creative process for you. Agony and ecstasy. Mostly agony.

Bard_15.speaker: Alfira
Bard_15.text: True. And when you finally perfect a song... there's nothing like it.
Bard_15.context: NodeContext: Face lights up. Sounds truly happy and filled with wonder. Music is what she loves the most in life. It inspires her and gives her hope.

Bard_100.speaker: Alfira
Bard_100.text: But when you're stuck, and it's just getting worse - ugh.

Bard_11.speaker: Player
Bard_11.text: Why are you songwriting now? Hardly the best time.

Bard_113.speaker: Alfira
Bard_113.text: I... we lost people on the way here.
Bard_113.context: NodeContext: She's thinking of her teacher who died on the way. Grief in her voice.

Bard_167.speaker: Alfira
Bard_167.text: And the dead deserve to be remembered. That's what my teacher always said.
Bard_167.context: NodeContext: She's thinking of her teacher who died on the way. Grief in her voice.

Bard_144.speaker: Player
Bard_144.text: Can I help you finish the song?

Bard_77.speaker: Alfira
Bard_77.context: NodeContext: Sad smile in her voice.

Bard_102.speaker: Player
Bard_102.text: This grove could become a battlefield soon enough. It's not the time for music.

Bard_213.speaker: Alfira
Bard_213.text: I know. I should be packing up, but I need to finish this song. It's... it's important.
Bard_213.context: NodeContext: Player has advised her to leave. But she can't - she has to finish her song. Frustrated, mainly at herself.

Bard_215.speaker: Player
Bard_215.text: Let me help you finish it, then.

Bard_150.speaker: Alfira
Bard_150.text: Hm. It can't hurt. I have her... I have an extra lute, if you want?
Bard_150.context: NodeContext: Hesitates at 'her'. This is her teacher's lute (who died on the way here). Needs the help and is looking for companionship while playing. Sounds unsure of herself.

Bard_101.speaker: Player
Bard_101.text: Hand me that lute. We can perform together.

Bard_282.context: NodeContext: Seated position. Holding her OWN lute in her lap with one hand. Reaches behind  with RIGHT hand into 'magic pocket' and holds out her TEACHER'S lute. Player takes the teacher's lute.

Bard_262.speaker: Alfira
Bard_262.text: I'll start from the beginning. We'll take it slow.
Bard_262.context: CinematicNodeContext: Seated position. Holding her OWN lute in her lap with one hand. Reaches behind  with RIGHT hand into 'magic pocket' and holds out her TEACHER'S lute. Player takes the teacher's lute.NodeContext: Encouraging tone. She's thrilled someone will play music with her again.

Bard_137.speaker: Alfira
Bard_137.text: Dance upon the stars tonight... Smile and pain will fade away...
Bard_137.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player is holding the lute - ready to begin playing.NodeContext: Gently sung.

Bard_51.speaker: Alfira
Bard_51.text: Words of mine will turn to ash... When you call the last light down...
Bard_51.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player and bard playing together. Player has a lute. Shot of the two playing in harmony as Alfira closes her eyes - it's a peaceful scene. NodeContext: Gently sung.

Bard_288.speaker: Alfira
Bard_288.text: That was... interesting. Why don't we try again?
Bard_288.context: CinematicNodeContext: Clanging sound as the player messes up - fingers banging against the lute. Bard winces in almost pain at the sound.

Bard_36.speaker: Alfira
Bard_36.text: Moon reminds me of your grace... All the love I can't repay... Rest and know that I will pray... Farewell, my dear old friend...
Bard_36.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player and bard play together. Scenic shot as the bard closes her eyes and sings - peaceful. When she finishes singing puts away OWN lute in magic pocket. Player also puts the TEACHER'S  lute into their magic pocket at the end.NodeContext: Gently sung. Eyes closed.

Bard_94.speaker: Alfira
Bard_94.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hiding her face as she cries, struggling to get herself under control. NodeContext: Face crumples as she begins bawling her eyes out. Cover her face. Embarassment in her voice as she tries to stop crying.

Bard_78.speaker: Player
Bard_78.text: Don't worry. Cry as much as you need.

Bard_117.speaker: Alfira
Bard_117.text: Heh. She'd have said the same thing.
Bard_117.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wiping away her tears, getting herself together. NodeContext: Smiling as she wipes away her tears.

Bard_134.speaker: Player
Bard_134.text: That song was beautiful. Worthy of a few tears.

Bard_79.speaker: Alfira
Bard_79.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wiping away her tears, getting herself together. NodeContext: Smiling as she wipes away her tears. Player has complimented her music. She's calming down after getting upset.

Bard_70.speaker: Alfira
Bard_70.text: That's the first time I've played since Lihala died. My teacher.
Bard_70.context: CinematicNodeContext: Can't look directly at the player. NodeContext: Sad and distant as she remembers the death of her teacher. Traumatised.

Bard_16.speaker: Alfira
Bard_16.text: She was playing her lute. We... didn't hear the gnolls coming.
Bard_16.context: CinematicNodeContext: Can't look directly at the player. NodeContext: Catch in her voice. More horrified than on the brink of crying.

Bard_121.speaker: Alfira
Bard_121.text: There was so much blood. I - I can still smell it.

Bard_200.speaker: Alfira
Bard_200.text: It was awful. I couldn't look at a lute without hearing her - screaming.
Bard_200.context: NodeContext: Horrified.  Clearly traumitised as she recalls the death of her teacher. Her teacher's death prevented her from playing music again.

Bard_214.speaker: Player
Bard_214.text: I'm sure your teacher would be proud to see you now.

Bard_145.speaker: Alfira
Bard_145.text: Heh. She'd yell at me for that clunky verse. And make me play 'til my fingers were raw.
Bard_145.context: NodeContext: Recalling how her teacher would yell at her. Fondness and love in her voice, It's a nice memory.

Bard_92.speaker: Alfira
Bard_92.text: And that's exactly what I'm going to do: finish The Weeping Dawn - for her.
Bard_92.context: NodeContext: Determined. This is her chance to take back control in her life.

Bard_89.speaker: Alfira
Bard_89.text: I've a long way to go, but thank you. I... I needed this.
Bard_89.context: NodeContext: Putting her gratitude into words as best she can. Sincere and genuine.

Bard_203.speaker: Narrator
Bard_203.text: *Too sweet, odiously sweet. The vomitous gall within despairs at your kindness.*

Bard_163.speaker: Player
Bard_163.text: Hardly a unique tale of woe these days. Toughen up, or you won't last.

Bard_93.speaker: Alfira
Bard_93.text: Keep the lute. Please. You've earned it.
Bard_93.context: NodeContext: Big smile - cheerful and grateful

Bard_133.speaker: Alfira
Bard_133.text: The Weeping Dawn will be my gift to Lihala. I've a long way to go, but thank you. I... I needed this.
Bard_133.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks at player. NodeContext: Put her gratitude into words as best she can. Sincere and genuine.

Bard_275.speaker: Player
Bard_275.text: Well, you've come up with a fine tribute to her.

Bard_35.speaker: Alfira
Bard_35.text: Lihala said that's why eulogies were important. They were for the living as well as the dead.
Bard_35.context: NodeContext: Smile and a short laugh. Fondness and love in her voice as she recalls her teacher. Grief as she recalls that the eulogy she was writing was as much for her benefit as well as Lihalas.

Bard_234.speaker: Alfira
Bard_234.text: I'd forgotten what it was like: that itch to perfect a song.
Bard_234.context: NodeContext: Hope returning to her voice.

Bard_33.speaker: Player
Bard_33.text: No need to be sorry. Though it still needs work.

Bard_206.speaker: Alfira
Bard_206.text: Heh. And then some. But I have the bones of the song - and that's what matters.
Bard_206.context: NodeContext: Player has told her the song needs work. She laughs as she agrees. Hope and determination.

Bard_147.speaker: Player
Bard_147.text: Well, would you look at this grove. So lovely. So... grove-like.

Bard_136.speaker: Alfira
Bard_136.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wiping away her tears, getting herself together. NodeContext: Smiling as she wipes away her tears. Player has made a show of looking away and not crowding her when she's upset. It's made her laugh.

Bard_7.speaker: Alfira
Bard_7.text: Look, erm, I really appreciate the help. But I think I should continue on my own. Thanks anyway.
Bard_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: The lute twangs and the tiefling stopped singing. She looks awkwardly at you.

Bard_146.speaker: Player
Bard_146.text: Slip the lute into your pack.

Bard_222.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player puts lute into magic pocket.

Bard_245.speaker: Alfira
Bard_245.text: Wait - what are you doing? Give that back! Right now!
Bard_245.context: CinematicNodeContext: Aflira puts her OWN lute into her magic pocket and frantically stands up.NodeContext: Player has just stolen her teacher's mandolin. Panic. It's the only thing she has of her teacher. Upset.

Bard_186.speaker: Alfira
Bard_186.text: Please. It was my teacher's. I don't have - I need it.

Bard_109.speaker: Alfira
Bard_109.text: You horrid, horrid beast. What is wrong with you?
Bard_109.context: NodeContext: Player has refused to return her teacher's lute. Upset. Horrified. In tears.

Bard_74.speaker: Alfira
Bard_74.text: Get the hells away from me.
Bard_74.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turnings away - furiousNodeContext: Starting to cry. Angry and upset.

Bard_220.speaker: Narrator
Bard_220.text: *Too sweet, odiously sweet. The vomitous gall within churns - she sickens you.*

Bard_189.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands the lute back to her.

Bard_18.speaker: Alfira
Bard_18.text: What is wrong with you? You told me you wanted to help!
Bard_18.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holding her TEACHER's lute. Almost cradling it.NodeContext: Player stole her instrument and then returned it. Upset. Horrified. Betrayed.

Bard_273.speaker: Alfira
Bard_273.text: Get the hells away from me.

Bard_107.speaker: Player
Bard_107.text: Here. I don't have time for this.

Bard_251.speaker: Alfira
Bard_251.text: Oh. All right. I mean - thanks anyway.
Bard_251.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks down at mandolin. NodeContext: Sad and dissappointed but trying to hide it.

Bard_29.speaker: Alfira
Bard_29.text: Where is it? Damn it. No, no!
Bard_29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standing up. Puts OWN lute away. Patting pockets AFTER. Looking around. NodeContext: Panicked.

Bard_38.speaker: Alfira
Bard_38.text: That was my teacher's. It's all I - I'm sorry. I have to find it.

Bard_32.speaker: Alfira
Bard_32.text: Hm. It can't hurt. What do you have in mind?
Bard_32.context: NodeContext: Hesitant. Wants the help but nervous.

Bard_86.speaker: Player
Bard_86.text: First things first - what's the song about?

Bard_76.speaker: Alfira
Bard_76.text: My teacher, Lihala. She loved dancing. Had two left feet, mind.
Bard_76.context: NodeContext: Smile in her voice as she thinks of her beloved teacher.

Bard_17.speaker: Alfira
Bard_17.text: I remember waking up one night on the road and seeing her - dancing beneath the stars... a huge smile on her face.
Bard_17.context: NodeContext: Laughs slightly as she thinks of the memory. Love in her voice.

Bard_277.speaker: Alfira
Bard_277.text: Thinking of it now - my heart hurts and my words just seem to crumble... like ash.

Bard_292.speaker: Alfira
Bard_292.text: Wait. Words of mine will turn to ash... That's perfect.
Bard_292.context: NodeContext: Excited. Inspiration is starting to return.

Bard_27.speaker: Player
Bard_27.text: Nod in encouragement and gesture to her lute.

Bard_71.speaker: Alfira
Bard_71.text: Words of mine will turn to ash...
Bard_71.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gently and sadly singing.NodeContext: Gently feeling out the words of the song, and with it, the pain and grief she feels for her teacher. Getting excited.

Bard_65.speaker: Alfira
Bard_65.text: ...when you call the last light down...
Bard_65.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gently and sadly singing.NodeContext: Gently and sadly singing. Feeling out the words.

Bard_82.speaker: Alfira
Bard_82.context: NodeContext: Excited. You have the line and are holding the entirety of the song in your head - and you have to sing it or it will disappear.

Bard_49.context: CinematicNodeContext: stands up. Cue cinematic of her singing. At end of song put lute in magic pocket.

Bard_197.speaker: Player
Bard_197.text: Keep going. What would you say to your teacher if she were here right now?

Bard_241.speaker: Alfira
Bard_241.text: That... that it's okay. That I'll be okay.
Bard_241.context: NodeContext: Player has asked what she wants to say to her teacher (who has died). She's trying to express that she doesn't want her teacher to worry about her. That she'll do her best. And that she loves her.

Bard_125.speaker: Player
Bard_125.text: All right - that's what your lyrics need to say.

Bard_87.speaker: Player
Bard_87.text: Never mind. This isn't going anywhere.

Bard_44.speaker: Alfira
Bard_44.text: Oh. Should I try something else? Be honest.
Bard_44.context: NodeContext: Looks and sounds like a kicked puppy, but means it when she says be honest.

Bard_140.speaker: Alfira
Bard_140.text: This song is for Lihala... my teacher. She - she died on the way here. I need to get this right.
Bard_140.context: NodeContext: Grief. Upset. Trying to hold it together.

Bard_2.speaker: Player
Bard_2.text: You're holding yourself back. Start over with a blank slate.

Bard_23.speaker: Alfira
Bard_23.text: But I... maybe you're right. It was broken to begin with.
Bard_23.context: NodeContext: Player has told her to start over. Doubting herself. Hurt and confused.

Bard_105.speaker: Alfira
Bard_105.text: I should start sketching out ideas. Thank you for the help, I guess.
Bard_105.context: NodeContext: Trying to sound thankful but kind of failing.

Bard_60.speaker: Player
Bard_60.text: You want honesty? Give up - you don't have the makings of a bard.

Bard_250.speaker: Alfira
Bard_250.context: NodeContext: Been told to give up her dream. Grief. Upset. Trying to hold it together.

Bard_258.speaker: Alfira
Bard_258.text: But I can't even finish this one song...

Bard_103.speaker: Alfira
Bard_103.text: Sorry, do you mind? You've given me a lot to think about.

Bard_296.speaker: Player
Bard_296.text: Forget what I said. You're doing just fine.

Bard_252.speaker: Alfira
Bard_252.text: Really? Good. That's good. Let's keep going.
Bard_252.context: NodeContext: Player has told her what she's doing works. She's almost talking to herself in reassurance.

Bard_81.speaker: Alfira
Bard_81.text: Moon... moon reminds me of your grace...
Bard_81.context: CinematicNodeContext: Very gently singing. Not playing. NodeContext: Gently feeling out the words of the song, and with it, the pain and grief she feels for her teacher.

Bard_152.speaker: Alfira
Bard_152.text: All the love I can't repay...
Bard_152.context: NodeContext: Gently feeling out the words.

Bard_170.speaker: Alfira
Bard_170.context: NodeContext: Moment she realises she has the song within her grasp. Excited.

Bard_54.speaker: Player
Bard_54.text: Perfectly awful. These are the worst lyrics I've ever heard.

Bard_43.speaker: Alfira
Bard_43.context: NodeContext: You sound absolutely gutted here - and you look like a kicked puppy. Player has just trashed your song.

Bard_283.speaker: Player
Bard_283.text: Let's start with the lyrics. Dance upon the stars tonight?

Bard_104.speaker: Alfira
Bard_104.text: It refers to a night on the road with my teacher, Lihala. I was fast asleep when I heard a noise.
Bard_104.context: NodeContext: Smile in her voice as she thinks of her beloved teacher and her terrible dancing.

Bard_177.speaker: Alfira
Bard_177.text: I woke up, and there she was - dancing beneath the stars... a huge smile on her face.

Bard_210.speaker: Player
Bard_210.text: The song's more important than survival? Fine - it's your life.

Bard_212.speaker: Alfira
Bard_212.text: And I'm sticking to it. Thank you ever so much.
Bard_212.context: NodeContext: Player has been condescending about her decision to play. She's determined and saracastic in her thanks.

Bard_225.speaker: Player
Bard_225.text: Snatch the lute out of her hands and smash it.

Bard_72.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player grabs the lute out of Alfira's hands and smashes it on the ground.

Bard_5.speaker: Alfira
Bard_5.text: What did you do?! My teacher gave me that! And she - and she's dead, you bastard.
Bard_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stands up. NodeContext: Player smashed your lute - you're hysterical and furious.

Bard_232.speaker: Alfira
Bard_232.text: I wanted to write a song for her and you - you ruined it. You ruined everything.

Bard_37.speaker: Alfira
Bard_37.text: You horrid, horrid beast. What is wrong with you?
Bard_37.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player reaches out to grab Alfira's lute. Alfira stays seated - twists her body to the side out of the way. While saying first phrase. Stands up after first phrase. Then says 'What is wrong with you?'. Holding own lute close.

Bard_286.speaker: Alfira
Bard_286.text: Get the hells away from me.
Bard_286.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holding own lute close.NodeContext: Angry.

Bard_8.speaker: Player
Bard_8.text: You'd better swap that lute for a weapon. You'll need one, soon enough.

Bard_165.speaker: Alfira
Bard_165.text: Violence doesn't fix everything, you know. Music can help in ways a silly blade can't.
Bard_165.context: NodeContext: Player has insulted your instrument and told you to pick up a blade. 'the silly blade' is a play on what the player said to you.

Bard_112.speaker: Alfira
Bard_112.text: Besides, I'm not doing this for me. This is for the people I... we lost on the way here. It's important.

Bard_247.speaker: Player
Bard_247.text: To sing outward, one must look inward. Why are you writing the song?

Bard_10.speaker: Player
Bard_10.text: How can I put this? That sounded a little... unpolished.

Bard_246.speaker: Alfira
Bard_246.text: It sounded like a cat being strangled. Godsdammit.
Bard_246.context: NodeContext: Speaking of her own music. Embarassed and frustrated with herself.

Bard_184.speaker: Player
Bard_184.text: Sing: 'Words of mine will turn to ash...'
Bard_184.context: CinematicNodeContext: This a quiet scene of colloboration between two musicians -

Bard_211.speaker: Alfira
Bard_211.text: Words of mine will turn to ash... When you call the last light down...
Bard_211.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to player in surprise, brow furrowed as she closes her eyes and sings then line - then a big smile as her eyes light up. She loves the line and turns to the player for the next. NodeContext: Surprise but joy as she sings in response to the player.

Bard_264.speaker: Player
Bard_264.text: Continue singing: 'Moon reminds me of your grace...'

Bard_228.speaker: Alfira
Bard_228.text: Moon reminds me of your grace... All the love I can't repay... Rest and know that I will pray... Farewell, my dear old friend.
Bard_228.context: CinematicNodeContext: Starts singing again with the new lyricsNodeContext: Sadness in her voice as she sings.

Bard_85.speaker: Alfira
Bard_85.text: All the love I can't repay... Rest and know that I will pray... Farewell, my dear old friend.

Bard_41.speaker: Alfira
Bard_41.text: Thank you. I was having trouble... finding the words.
Bard_41.context: NodeContext: Choking up slightly. Grateful but also overwhelmed with emotion.

Bard_235.speaker: Player
Bard_235.text: You're welcome. Just keep at it.

Bard_30.speaker: Alfira
Bard_30.text: It's been so long since I... since...
Bard_30.context: NodeContext: Starting to get upset. About to cry. She hasn't played with anyone since her teacher died. With Lihala's death, she thought her gift of music was gone. Now she realises it was there all along.

Bard_9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Puts lute away in magic pocket and starts to cry.

Bard_230.speaker: Alfira
Bard_230.context: NodeContext: Bursts into tears. Upset. Embarassed and grieving.

Bard_59.speaker: Alfira
Bard_59.context: NodeContext: You're trying to pull yourself together after getting upset.

Bard_153.speaker: Alfira
Bard_153.text: I haven't finished a song since Lihala died. Haven't played at all, if I'm honest.
Bard_153.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gripping lute tightly.NodeContext: Sad and distant as she remembers the death of her teacher. Traumatised.

Bard_135.speaker: Alfira
Bard_135.text: Until now. I'd forgotten what it was like: that itch in my fingers to perfect a song.

Bard_108.speaker: Alfira
Bard_108.text: The Weeping Dawn will be my gift to her. Thank you. I... I needed this.
Bard_108.context: NodeContext: Putting her gratitude into words as best she can. Sincere and genuine.

Bard_166.speaker: Player
Bard_166.text: I'm sure your teacher would be proud to see you now.

Bard_271.speaker: Alfira
Bard_271.text: Heh. She'd yell at me for that metre. And make me play it over and over again.
Bard_271.context: NodeContext: Smile and a short laugh. Fondness and love in her voice.

Bard_285.speaker: Player
Bard_285.text: Hardly a unique tale of woe these days. Toughen up, or you won't last.

Bard_190.speaker: Alfira
Bard_190.text: You're right. She'd have said the same.
Bard_190.context: NodeContext: Love and a smile in her voice.

Bard_263.speaker: Player
Bard_263.text: Well, you've come up with a fine tribute to her.

Bard_126.speaker: Alfira
Bard_126.text: Thanks. Lihala made me love music: the sound, the feel, the thrill. But when she died... it was gone.
Bard_126.context: NodeContext: Love and sincerity in her voice at the thought of her teacher.

Bard_97.speaker: Player
Bard_97.text: It's all right. Let it all out.

Bard_179.speaker: Alfira
Bard_179.text: I don't usually - I'm all right.
Bard_179.context: NodeContext: You're trying to pull yourself together after getting upset.

Bard_261.speaker: Alfira
Bard_261.context: NodeContext: Starting to get upset. About to cry.

Bard_294.speaker: Player
Bard_294.text: Finding the words is an important part of being a singer, you know.

Bard_99.speaker: Player
Bard_99.text: That was terrible. I'll show you how it's done.

Bard_284.speaker: Player
Bard_284.text: What did that poor instrument ever do to you? You're butchering it.

Bard_196.speaker: Alfira
Bard_196.text: You think I don't know that?
Bard_196.context: NodeContext: Player has insulted her music. She's embarassed and frustrated with herself.

Bard_55.speaker: Player
Bard_55.text: Listen closely. I'll show you how to do it right.

Bard_223.speaker: Alfira
Bard_223.text: My teacher always said a good musician never demands a solo.
Bard_223.context: NodeContext: Player has offered to 'show her how it was done'. Snarky and offended.

Bard_265.speaker: Alfira
Bard_265.text: And I have no time for amateurs. Thanks.
Bard_265.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turn away in dismissal. NodeContext: Curshing dismissal. Sarcastic.

Bard_19.speaker: Player
Bard_19.text: Well, I don't know. Perhaps the lute had it coming.

Bard_217.speaker: Alfira
Bard_217.text: Heh. Yes, it's led quite a life of crime. I'm simply putting it out of its misery...
Bard_217.context: NodeContext: Laughs. Playing along with the player's jokes about her lute.

Bard_138.speaker: Alfira
Bard_138.text: ...by slowly killing it with this song. Urgh. I can't... nothing fits, you know?

Bard_188.speaker: Player
Bard_188.text: It's a bad song, plain and simple.

Bard_159.speaker: Player
Bard_159.text: I take it back. What you're doing is perfect.

Bard_281.speaker: Alfira
Bard_281.text: Thank goodness. I feel like I'm so close. Let me try again.

Bard_272.speaker: Player
Bard_272.text: Maybe the life of a bard just isn't for you.

Bard_115.speaker: Alfira
Bard_115.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bard is sitting on the rock.NodeContext: Annoyed and frustrated with herself. Sings the opening.

Bard_57.speaker: Alfira
Bard_57.text: This song will be the death of me.
Bard_57.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bard is sitting on the rock.NodeContext: Annoyed and frustrated with self.

Bard_124.speaker: Alfira
Bard_124.text: I started fresh with that song.
Bard_124.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Bard_280.speaker: Alfira
Bard_280.text: I haven't, well, come up with anything yet. But I'm sure it'll come to me... eventually.
Bard_280.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Bard_207.speaker: Alfira
Bard_207.text: Why would someone do that? Why would someone destroy my lute?
Bard_207.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bard is standing next to the rock.NodeContext: Utterly furious and angry

Bard_218.speaker: Alfira
Bard_218.text: I just wanted to - to thank her. To honour her, you know? And now I'll never finish her eulogy.
Bard_218.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bard is standing next to the rock.NodeContext: Griefing - upset. On the brink of crying.

Bard_236.speaker: Alfira
Bard_236.text: How could you break it?! I hope - I hope you're ripped apart by gnolls, you beast.
Bard_236.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bard is standing next to the rock.NodeContext: Utterly furious and angry

Bard_253.speaker: Alfira
Bard_253.text: I shouldn't have let that lute out of my sight. I'm an idiot.
Bard_253.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bard is standing next to the rock.NodeContext: Someone stole her lute. It was all she had left of her teacher's. She feels stupid and like it's her fault.

Bard_202.speaker: Player
Bard_202.text: It was just a joke. Here's your lute.

Bard_233.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player gives lute to Alfira.

Bard_139.speaker: Alfira
Bard_139.text: What?! Is it - ? No scratches, strings seem intact...
Bard_139.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking over the lute to make sure it's okay. NodeContext: Player returned her lute. Surprised. Suspicious. Checking the instrument.

Bard_20.speaker: Alfira
Bard_20.text: Look, thank you for returning it, but just - just leave me alone.
Bard_20.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dismissal. Backing away almost. NodeContext: Grateful to have it back, but doesn't trust the player. Angry and pleading.

Bard_255.speaker: Alfira
Bard_255.text: Leave me be. I'm in the middle of something.
Bard_255.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standing - luteNodeContext: Stern but friendly.

Bard_257.speaker: Alfira
Bard_257.text: It's still rough, but my song is getting there!
Bard_257.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bard is sitting on the rock.NodeContext: Her song is on the way to being finished. Happy and full of hope - thought she'd never player again.

Bard_278.speaker: Alfira
Bard_278.text: Don't come near me. I mean it.
Bard_278.context: NodeContext: Upset. Angry. And a little scared. Player stole her lute and she wants nothing to do with them.

AD_QuitComposing_0.speaker: Alfira
AD_QuitComposing_0.text: I could be a poet? Urgh. I'd probably be terrible at that too...
AD_QuitComposing_0.context: NodeContext: Doesn't sound hopeful. Was convinced by the player to quit music. Dejected.

AD_QuitComposing_1.speaker: Alfira
AD_QuitComposing_1.text: I have to do something in Baldur's Gate. But what?
AD_QuitComposing_1.context: NodeContext: Doesn't sound hopeful. Was convinced by the player to quit music. Dejected.

AD_QuitComposing_3.speaker: Alfira
AD_QuitComposing_3.text: If not a bard, then an adventurer? No, I don't have the stomach for it.
AD_QuitComposing_3.context: NodeContext: Doesn't sound hopeful. Was convinced by the player to quit music. Dejected.

AD_Dejected_0.speaker: Alfira
AD_Dejected_0.context: NodeContext: She has 'lost' her instrument (player stole it). You are on the brink of tears, feeling lost and ashamed - you wanted to write a song for your teacher, and now you never will. You feel like a failure.

AD_Dejected_1.speaker: Alfira
AD_Dejected_1.text: Gods, why did I even bother?
AD_Dejected_1.context: NodeContext: She has 'lost' her instrument (player stole it). You are on the brink of tears, feeling lost and ashamed - you wanted to write a song for your teacher, and now you never will. You feel like a failure.

AD_Dejected_2.speaker: Alfira
AD_Dejected_2.text: I'll never finish her song now...
AD_Dejected_2.context: NodeContext: She has 'lost' her instrument (player stole it). You are on the brink of tears, feeling lost and ashamed - you wanted to write a song for your teacher, and now you never will. You feel like a failure.

Animals_2.speaker: Corinna
Animals_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: The camera starts on the bard, then pans to the animals.InternalNodeContext: We should be able to hear the bards song in the background, overshadowed be the animals complaining.NodeContext: The animals are listening to someone sing and play the lute. They hate the sound and are uncomfortable.

Animals_32.speaker: Spar
Animals_32.context: NodeContext: The animals are listening to someone sing and play the lute. They hate the sound and are uncomfortable.

Animals_20.speaker: Player
Animals_20.text: It is quite a racket. You could just spare your ears by leaving.

Animals_23.speaker: Corinna
Animals_23.text: We can't! Our brains are melting!

Animals_34.speaker: Spar
Animals_34.text: Corinna, drag me away! The big one is right - we should go, before it's too late.

Animals_16.speaker: Corinna
Animals_16.text: With my last strength, I will save us both! Away. Away.
Animals_16.context: CinematicNodeContext: The critters leave.NodeContext: played dramatics

Animals_24.speaker: Player
Animals_24.text: Sing along with the bard - as loudly and off-key as you can.

Animals_33.speaker: Player
Animals_33.text: Sing for them, improvising lyrics: 'How can we stop this dreadful song, half-formed verse from devil's tongue?'

Animals_27.speaker: Player
Animals_27.text: Don't mock her - she's trying her best... I assume.

Animals_0.speaker: Spar
Animals_0.text: Oh no! Whatever shall we do?
Animals_0.context: NodeContext: amused, ironic, making fun of the player.

Animals_1.speaker: Corinna
Animals_1.context: NodeContext: amused, ironic, making fun of the player.

Animals_21.speaker: Corinna
Animals_21.text: My head is melting! I'm leaving before the damage is permanent.
Animals_21.context: CinematicNodeContext: The critters leave.NodeContext: amused, ironic, making fun of the player.

Animals_29.speaker: Narrator
Animals_29.text: *The critters start a duet of their own, attempting to drown out the bard's music. They look at you expectantly.*
Animals_29.context: NodeContext: watching a bird and a squirrel sing together

Animals_15.speaker: Player
Animals_15.text: Bravo. You could go on tour, with talent like that.

Animals_11.speaker: Spar
Animals_11.text: Of course - we are born performers.

Animals_5.speaker: Corinna
Animals_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: The critters leave.NodeContext: throwing shade at the bard, snickering

Animals_14.speaker: Player
Animals_14.text: Sing along with them, improvising lyrics: 'How can we stop this dreadful song, half-formed verse from devil's tongue?'

Animals_30.speaker: Corinna
Animals_30.text: Finally, a song to set our heads straight after that display. We should leave, before the effect wears off.

Animals_12.speaker: Corinna
Animals_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: The critters leave.NodeContext: played dramatics

Animals_18.speaker: Player
Animals_18.text: Shut up - I want to hear the bard.

Animals_31.speaker: Corinna
Animals_31.context: NodeContext: This is a squirrel screeching.

Animals_4.speaker: Spar
Animals_4.context: NodeContext: This is a squirrel squeeking

AD_ComposingSong_2.speaker: Alfira
AD_ComposingSong_2.text: When you call the last light...
AD_ComposingSong_2.context: NodeContext: Hesitantly singing the song, feeling out the words as you compose.

AD_ComposingSong_1.speaker: Alfira
AD_ComposingSong_1.context: NodeContext: Hesitant as you try to figure out the song.

AD_ComposingSong_3.speaker: Alfira
AD_ComposingSong_3.context: NodeContext: Frustrated - feeling like a failure.

AD_ComposingSong_4.speaker: Alfira
AD_ComposingSong_4.context: NodeContext: Hesitantly singing the song, feeling out the words as you compose.

AD_ComposingSong_0.speaker: Alfira
AD_ComposingSong_0.context: NodeContext: Hopeful and then you immediately doubt yourself.

AD_ComposingSong_8.speaker: Alfira
AD_ComposingSong_8.context: NodeContext: Frustrated - feeling like a failure.

AD_ComposingSong_6.speaker: Alfira
AD_ComposingSong_6.context: NodeContext: Hesitantly singing the song, feeling out the words as you compose.

AD_ComposingSong_9.speaker: Alfira
AD_ComposingSong_9.context: NodeContext: Doubtful and frustrated with yourself. You think everything do you is terrible.

AD_ComposingSong_5.speaker: Alfira
AD_ComposingSong_5.context: NodeContext: Frustrated - feeling like a failure.

AD_StartingOver_1.speaker: Alfira
AD_StartingOver_1.context: NodeContext: Player has convinced her to start from scratch with the song. Doubts herself. Hates what she's working on. Dejected.

AD_StartingOver_2.speaker: Alfira
AD_StartingOver_2.context: NodeContext: Player has convinced her to start from scratch with the song. Doubts herself. Hates what she's working on. Dejected.

AD_StartingOver_3.speaker: Alfira
AD_StartingOver_3.context: NodeContext: Player has convinced her to start from scratch with the song. Doubts herself. Hates what she's working on. Dejected.

AD_FullSong_5.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong_5.context: NodeContext: Gently singing. Sad but hopeful.

AD_FullSong_10.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong_10.text: Smile and pain will fade away.

AD_FullSong_2.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong_2.text: Words of mine will turn to ash.

AD_FullSong_6.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong_6.text: When you call the last light down.

AD_FullSong_3.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong_3.text: Moon. Sun. All remind me of your grace.

AD_FullSong_12.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong_12.text: Faith. Care. All the love I can't repay.

AD_FullSong_11.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong_11.text: Moon reminds me of your grace.

AD_FullSong_1.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong_1.text: All the love I can't repay.

AD_FullSong_7.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong_7.text: Rest and know that I will pray.

AD_FullSong_9.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong_9.text: Moon. Sun. All remind me of your grace.

AD_FullSong_4.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong_4.text: Faith. Care. All the love I can't repay.
